programme.title: Valan
Valan - Dolina aniołów
programme.desc: Directed by Béla Bagota. With Csaba Krisztik, András Hatházi, Tollas Gábor, Júlia Nyakó. Peter returns to his Transylvanian hometown, Valan, where a dead body was found in the snow-capped mountains. The investigation about his 22 years missing sister leads him to the maze of grave sins of present and the past, where he has to fight not only with local criminals but his own demons too.

programme.desc: Directed by Jonathan Desoindre, Ella Kowalska. With Tewfik Jallab, Aadar Malik, Xavier Boiffier, Meriem Serbah. Sunil is a 30-year-old delivery man of Indian origin. basketball coach is sentenced to community service, forced to work with a team of mentally disabled players.","keywords":"singing in a car,singing on a bus,singing in an rv,singing on airplane,basketball","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6793580/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"realart_ds"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice movie, nice crew & a good message","reviewBody":"In the ironic world in which we live today, where the rights for all should be something common and accepted, where discrimination should be a word forgotten by the past, we realize that for nothing sexual,gender rights or worst in basic human rights as being able to be treated the same regardless of physical aspects or medical differences, the human is still being unable to treat the others as he would like to be treated himself . 

In this film we see this reality, but we also see how that assumption we always make in the face of what others can and can not do ends up being wrong. 

The improvement and achievements that for some do not seem to be the great thing, for many is an epic achievement. 

This film is not only well done in the film aspect, it also gave in the background aspect a lesson , that I hope many apply in their lives.

Not always the best movies have implicit the great effects, famous actors, and millionaire budgets, in this case the casting was perfect choice, the touch that the protagonists in real life are people with "mental disability", and I think they should be an example for many actors that today are more divas than what they act, the movie gave us also a script well taken, turns in to a comedy that takes you to the joy at times, (not simple laughs) and that true feeling sensation , and a very good direction that I think has merits that I hope the academy and the public in general can recognize.

For last ,remember we all are the same ............HUMANS, the movies should be this, something inclusive, as everything else should be

A movie that has to be seen by everyone, 100% enjoyable and to have a good time at the cinema

The film deals with sexual desire and violence but is very much not a slasher film. I found it creepy and it made me uncomfortable, in a good way.\n\nI recognized Luke Cook from SABRINA on Netflix. Dakota Shapiro is handsome and talented and the two of them are really good together. Luke is hilarious! A good bit of comic relief in a dark film. After watching this film you will definitely want to cover your webcam!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":74,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4</script><metacontent="

basketball coach is sentenced to community service, forced to work with a team of mentally disabled players.","keywords":"singing in a car,singing on a bus,singing in an rv,singing on airplane,basketball","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6793580/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"realart_ds"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice movie, nice crew & a good message","reviewBody":"In the ironic world in which we live today, where the rights for all should be something common and accepted, where discrimination should be a word forgotten by the past, we realize that for nothing sexual,gender rights or worst in basic human rights as being able to be treated the same regardless of physical aspects or medical differences, the human is still being unable to treat the others as he would like to be treated himself . 

In this film we see this reality, but we also see how that assumption we always make in the face of what others can and can not do ends up being wrong. 

The improvement and achievements that for some do not seem to be the great thing, for many is an epic achievement. 

This film is not only well done in the film aspect, it also gave in the background aspect a lesson , that I hope many apply in their lives.

Not always the best movies have implicit the great effects, famous actors, and millionaire budgets, in this case the casting was perfect choice, the touch that the protagonists in real life are people with "mental disability", and I think they should be an example for many actors that today are more divas than what they act, the movie gave us also a script well taken, turns in to a comedy that takes you to the joy at times, (not simple laughs) and that true feeling sensation , and a very good direction that I think has merits that I hope the academy and the public in general can recognize.

For last ,remember we all are the same ............HUMANS, the movies should be this, something inclusive, as everything else should be

A movie that has to be seen by everyone, 100% enjoyable and to have a good time at the cinema

theory","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0268978/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chicagoconsultant"},"dateCreated":"2012-01-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Superb Acting and a Gem of a Film","reviewBody":"Ed Harris, Russel Crowe, Jennifer Connelly, and Paul Bettany were terrific.

The film had great balance and is worth a viewing.

The story boldly addresses mental illness as a handicap.

Because of the quality of the acting and directing, this movie is a beacon of hope for people of all disabilities. The film illustrates to the viewer how deeply a handicap can infiltrate the domestic, professional, and personal lives of those unfortunate to have these types of issues. I hope Ron Howard and the acting crew can get together again for something similar. This was a great film, that also serves an important role for awareness to people that might not understand how deeply debilitating these issues can be, and also gets the message across that not all should be marginalized.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":864236,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

Trailer from Paramount"},"datePublished":"2000-02-10","description":"Haunted by the patients he failed to save, an extremely burned-out Manhattan ambulance paramedic fights to maintain his sanity over three fraught and turbulent nights.","keywords":"post punk,movie flop,paramount,disney,ghost","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0163988/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob the moo"},"dateCreated":"2004-05-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Narrative-wise it is unsatisfying but it has style and pace that makes it worth seeing","reviewBody":"Frank Pierce is a New York City paramedic. We join his story when he is facing down a double shift of graveyard work despite being burnt out and tired he battles through. Facing the ghosts of those he has lost on the job, Frank tries to help the usual junkies and heart failures but gets involved with Mary when he gets called to her father's heart attack. Despite his tiredness, he tries to help Mary's more emotional pain.

My plot summary for this film is weak, I know that. However it is not weak because I am in a rush, it is weak because the film's narrative is also weak. The basic set up is interesting and this carries the film for the first hour but after this the film tries to settle into more of a story then it falls to bits. For the first half of the film the action is carried by it's visual style and it's pace  it is effortless to watch and is very slick and interesting. Indeed whenever the film stays away from it's story with Mary and focuses on style then it is most enjoyable. It may be very episodic during it's stylish tour of those in need of help but it's is enjoyable nonetheless. However when the film tries to follow a thread with Mary it becomes dull and you realize that this may have style in bucket loads but the substance was given out using an eggcup. For this reason I found it ultimately unsatisfying despite being worth a watch for Scorsese at work.

As a director he really pulls out the stops, it looks great and is visually never dull even if it's narrative is. The soundtrack is also very good even if it could easily be accused of excess in the same way as the visuals could be. Even though this is Scorsese's film, the cast still do OK if not great.

Cage is convincingly washed out for the duration even if isn't as good a character as he hoped. Arquette is not quite as bad as I've seen her but she is still quite poor here. She isn't great and it is partly her fault but also the fault of the material  after all she is given the poor narrative to carry. Goodman has presence if not much to do while Rhames and Sizemore really enjoy their OTT characters. Anthony and Turturro add to the film in minor roles (Anthony being especially good) but I didn't feel like Curtis worked in his role even if he was another well-known face and I was amused by Reyes in a pre-Scrubs medical role.

Overall this is a film that is all about the ride and, for that, it's worth seeing. I enjoyed it's energy, it's pace and it's style in terms of visuals and music, however the narrative is episodic at best and weak for the rest of the time. The best performances are mostly OTT, befitting the excessive mood set by Scorsese's direction but as enjoyable as it is on a stylish, pacey level it isn't satisfying as a total film or as a story."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":64927,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

moo","dateCreated":"2004-05-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Narrative-wise it is unsatisfying but it has style and pace that makes it worth seeing","reviewBody":"Frank Pierce is a New York City paramedic. We join his story when he is facing down a double shift of graveyard work despite being burnt out and tired he battles through. Facing the ghosts of those he has lost on the job, Frank tries to help the usual junkies and heart failures but gets involved with Mary when he gets called to her father's heart attack. Despite his tiredness, he tries to help Mary's more emotional pain.

My plot summary for this film is weak, I know that. However it is not weak because I am in a rush, it is weak because the film's narrative is also weak. The basic set up is interesting and this carries the film for the first hour but after this the film tries to settle into more of a story then it falls to bits. For the first half of the film the action is carried by it's visual style and it's pace  it is effortless to watch and is very slick and interesting. Indeed whenever the film stays away from it's story with Mary and focuses on style then it is most enjoyable. It may be very episodic during it's stylish tour of those in need of help but it's is enjoyable nonetheless. However when the film tries to follow a thread with Mary it becomes dull and you realize that this may have style in bucket loads but the substance was given out using an eggcup. For this reason I found it ultimately unsatisfying despite being worth a watch for Scorsese at work.

As a director he really pulls out the stops, it looks great and is visually never dull even if it's narrative is. The soundtrack is also very good even if it could easily be accused of excess in the same way as the visuals could be. Even though this is Scorsese's film, the cast still do OK if not great.

Cage is convincingly washed out for the duration even if isn't as good a character as he hoped. Arquette is not quite as bad as I've seen her but she is still quite poor here. She isn't great and it is partly her fault but also the fault of the material  after all she is given the poor narrative to carry. Goodman has presence if not much to do while Rhames and Sizemore really enjoy their OTT characters. Anthony and Turturro add to the film in minor roles (Anthony being especially good) but I didn't feel like Curtis worked in his role even if he was another well-known face and I was amused by Reyes in a pre-Scrubs medical role.

Overall this is a film that is all about the ride and, for that, it's worth seeing. I enjoyed it's energy, it's pace and it's style in terms of visuals and music, however the narrative is episodic at best and weak for the rest of the time. The best performances are mostly OTT, befitting the excessive mood set by Scorsese's direction but as enjoyable as it is on a stylish, pacey level it isn't satisfying as a total film or as a story.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":64927,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"duration":"PT2H1M"</script><metacontent="

raps","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0810922/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jakek924"},"dateCreated":"2011-03-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great movie, never went over the top","reviewBody":"This movie started out slowly, but about 20 minutes in really started to kick off.

To start, the plot was way better than what the commercials revealed, and it was just a feel good fun movie.

Although it wasn't non stop laughter through the whole movie, it was great humor and the right times. 

We've been spoiled by some comedies lately that have you laughing when you enter til you leave, and the newest movies that are coming out are trying to replicate that and usually fail by going way over the top. For example, the other guys, get him to the Greek. 

Take Me Home Tonight went back to just being a simple good comedy that NEVER went over the top. Topher Grace does an awesome job, and Dan Fogler is absolutely hilarious in it. It only gets an 8 because nothing ever gets a 10 and 9's are impossible. I would give it an 8.5 if I could though. Very pleased. Go see it!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51603,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1570728/","name":"Crazy, Stupid, Love.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2MjkwMTM0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzc4NDg2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0136797/","name":"Steve Carell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0331516/","name":"Ryan Gosling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275629/","name":"Glenn Ficarra"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720135/","name":"John Requa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0259041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557594/","name":"Dan Fogelman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Crazy, Stupid, Love.","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3722091801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MTY2NzgwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzYzNDg4NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MTY2NzgwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzYzNDg4NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Newly single Cal Weaver (Steve Carell) is taken on as wingman and protÃ©gÃ© to handsome, thirtysomething player Jacob Palmer (Ryan Gosling). Despite a makeover and many new conquests, the one thing that canÂ’t be made over is his love for his wife (Julianne), who cheated on him and thinks she wants a divorce."},"datePublished":"2011-07-29","description":"A middle-aged husband's life changes dramatically when his wife asks him for a divorce. He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars.","keywords":"divorce,male objectification,marriage,bar,one night stand","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1570728/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"taleeya"},"dateCreated":"2011-07-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasantly surprised, a great movie overall!","reviewBody":"I saw this expecting an amusing, albeit predictable, movie. Boy was I pleasantly surprised! 

Steve Carell plays a man, Cal, blindsided by his wife's sudden request for a divorce. While wallowing in self pity at the local bar, Jacob (Ryan Gossling) decides to turn him into a project, and introduce him to the wonderful world of womanizing.....But you've seen that from the previews right? What comes next is a great look at love, from first crushes to long term marriage.

This movie is the perfect blend of funny and sweet (the entire theatre was laughing throughout). Great performances from the whole cast, including a surprisingly refreshing change for Steve Carell. The writing was perfect, the pacing was great.... A perfect date movie! Not overly sappy and not typical "chick flick" drivel.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":482507,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars.","keywords":"divorce,male objectification,marriage,bar,one night stand","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1570728/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"taleeya","dateCreated":"2011-07-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasantly surprised, a great movie overall!","reviewBody":"I saw this expecting an amusing, albeit predictable, movie. Boy was I pleasantly surprised! 

Steve Carell plays a man, Cal, blindsided by his wife's sudden request for a divorce. While wallowing in self pity at the local bar, Jacob (Ryan Gossling) decides to turn him into a project, and introduce him to the wonderful world of womanizing.....But you've seen that from the previews right? What comes next is a great look at love, from first crushes to long term marriage.

This movie is the perfect blend of funny and sweet (the entire theatre was laughing throughout). Great performances from the whole cast, including a surprisingly refreshing change for Steve Carell. The writing was perfect, the pacing was great.... A perfect date movie! Not overly sappy and not typical "chick flick" drivel.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":482507,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"duration":"PT1H58M"</script><metacontent="

A murder mystery brings together a private eye, a struggling actress, and a thief masquerading as an actor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0373469/","name":"Kiss Kiss Bang Bang","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NDExMDA3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTc2MzA3._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000375/","name":"Robert Downey Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000174/","name":"Val Kilmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157358/","name":"Michelle Monaghan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000948/","name":"Shane Black"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019968/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0356539/","name":"Brett Halliday"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000948/","name":"Shane Black"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kiss Kiss Bang Bang","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi562411033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1MzI3MTE0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzkyMDQyMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1MzI3MTE0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzkyMDQyMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Kiss Kiss Bang Bang"},"datePublished":"2005-11-18","description":"A murder mystery brings together a private eye, a struggling actress, and a thief masquerading as an actor.","keywords":"neo noir,actor,thief,kidnapping,nightclub","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0373469/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Flagrant-Baronessa"},"dateCreated":"2006-08-03","inLanguage":"English","name":""I'm retired. I invented dice. What do you do?"","reviewBody":"A lucky mistake shifts out-of-luck criminal Harry Lockhart (Robert Downey Jr) from the gritty streets to glossy showbiz in L.A, landing him a part in an upcoming film. Another mistake then shifts him from actor to private detective, and this is where Val Kilmer comes in and things start to go wrong, more wrong and unbelievably wrong until they've snowballed into an enjoyable detective mess -- all to impress failed actress Harmony (Next big thing: Michelle Monaghan).

Shane Black's directorial debut 'Kiss Kiss Bang Bang' is a comic film noir. Even in the dazzling opening credits using a montage of contrasts of red, black and white, it is evident that this is no run-of-the-mill crime story, but a viciously entertaining ride from scene 01. What makes it so special is that it mixes equal doses of humour and crime like a $15,000,000 blender, pouring out a balanced end product and glazing it with a clever narrative coating by Robert Downey Jr. Black also sprinkles some rapid-fire dialogue onto his product, which is facilitated by the comedic chemistry between Downey and Kilmer. Some of the lines, gags and images are truly laugh-out-loud worthy. Everything else is nice, but forgettable.

Its only problem, as far as I can see it, is its paper-thin plot. It does not seem believable; it is complex, dizzying and not nearly as involving as it would like to be. So back to formula on that one, and Kiss Kiss Bang Bang would be a near-perfect comedy-thriller.

7.5/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":217419,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

Another mistake then shifts him from actor to private detective, and this is where Val Kilmer comes in and things start to go wrong, more wrong and unbelievably wrong until they've snowballed into an enjoyable detective mess -- all to impress failed actress Harmony (Next big thing: Michelle Monaghan).

Shane Black's directorial debut 'Kiss Kiss Bang Bang' is a comic film noir. Even in the dazzling opening credits using a montage of contrasts of red, black and white, it is evident that this is no run-of-the-mill crime story, but a viciously entertaining ride from scene 01. What makes it so special is that it mixes equal doses of humour and crime like a $15,000,000 blender, pouring out a balanced end product and glazing it with a clever narrative coating by Robert Downey Jr. Black also sprinkles some rapid-fire dialogue onto his product, which is facilitated by the comedic chemistry between Downey and Kilmer. Ed Skrein, Patrick Wilson, Luke Evans, Aaron Eckhart, Nick Jonas, Etsushi Toyokawa, Tadanobu Asano, Luke Kleintank, Jun Kunimura, Darren Criss, Keean Johnson, Alexander Ludwig, with Mandy Moore, Dennis Quaid and Woody Harrelson."},"datePublished":"2019-11-08","description":"The story of the Battle of Midway, told by the leaders and the sailors who fought it.","keywords":"world war two,battle of midway,war at sea,warplane,u.s. military","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6924650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jimschultze"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Both good and disappointing - depends on the target audience","reviewBody":"As someone very knowledgeable about the subject, I was somewhat disappointed. Whether it was the wrinkled uniforms, the painful dialogue, the over-the-top dramatics and exaggerated explosions (hey, it's Emmerich!)... it was clear the film was not made for people like me who know the details and the characters very well.

The rating depends greatly on the target audience. It's clear this film was made for a younger audience, and as such, it does a very good job of conveying the history quite accurately. It's a lot to take on with a 2:20 movie (complete with a 6-month summary of events leading up to the title battle) and it does a fine job of that.

Correct history of this great nation tragically just isn't taught anymore, so I heartily applaud any effort to do so. I just wonder if younger audiences have any desire to learn it. So if I'm rating from that perspective, it jumps up a few points.

I just wish a little more care with the details and script had been taken to leave the older audience satisfied from our knowledge level.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70826,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

Whether it was the wrinkled uniforms, the painful dialogue, the over-the-top dramatics and exaggerated explosions (hey, it's Emmerich!)... it was clear the film was not made for people like me who know the details and the characters very well.

The rating depends greatly on the target audience. It's clear this film was made for a younger audience, and as such, it does a very good job of conveying the history quite accurately. It's a lot to take on with a 2:20 movie (complete with a 6-month summary of events leading up to the title battle) and it does a fine job of that.

Correct history of this great nation tragically just isn't taught anymore, so I heartily applaud any effort to do so. I just wonder if younger audiences have any desire to learn it. So if I'm rating from that perspective, it jumps up a few points.

Love Express: Przypadek Waleriana Borowczyka
programme.desc: Directed by Kuba Mikurda. With Thierry Bazin, Bertrand Bonello, Walerian Borowczyk, Peter Bradshaw. A documentary celebrating the work of Walerian Borowczyk, a director of unparalleled sensitivity, revered in the 1970s, who was later labeled as a maker of erotic movies. basketball coach is sentenced to community service, forced to work with a team of mentally disabled players.","keywords":"singing in a car,singing on a bus,singing in an rv,singing on airplane,basketball","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6793580/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"realart_ds"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice movie, nice crew & a good message","reviewBody":"In the ironic world in which we live today, where the rights for all should be something common and accepted, where discrimination should be a word forgotten by the past, we realize that for nothing sexual,gender rights or worst in basic human rights as being able to be treated the same regardless of physical aspects or medical differences, the human is still being unable to treat the others as he would like to be treated himself . 

In this film we see this reality, but we also see how that assumption we always make in the face of what others can and can not do ends up being wrong. 

The improvement and achievements that for some do not seem to be the great thing, for many is an epic achievement. 

This film is not only well done in the film aspect, it also gave in the background aspect a lesson , that I hope many apply in their lives.

Not always the best movies have implicit the great effects, famous actors, and millionaire budgets, in this case the casting was perfect choice, the touch that the protagonists in real life are people with "mental disability", and I think they should be an example for many actors that today are more divas than what they act, the movie gave us also a script well taken, turns in to a comedy that takes you to the joy at times, (not simple laughs) and that true feeling sensation , and a very good direction that I think has merits that I hope the academy and the public in general can recognize.

For last ,remember we all are the same ............HUMANS, the movies should be this, something inclusive, as everything else should be

A movie that has to be seen by everyone, 100% enjoyable and to have a good time at the cinema

EN HORABUENA JAVIER FESSER","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9359,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Resistance Fighters
Bakterie odporne na wszystko
programme.desc: Directed by Michael Wech. With Tanveer Ahmed, Edward Allera, Uwe Behrens, Kevin Brown. The UN General Assembly regards antibiotic-resistance as a "global and most urgent threat". The WHO alarms that we could fall back into a "post-antibiotic age". The film tells us how we got there: It is a story about how negligence, greed, and short-sightedness have rendered the lifesaving effects of antibiotics powerless. It is a science-thriller about disillusioned, fighting doctors, rebellious...
programme.review: --- Actors: Tanveer Ahmed (role=Self - Ass. Professor Plast. "Eric Clapton: Live at the Royal Albert Hall" (2015) is a one terrific evening with Eric Clapton. Its all here and live - "Tears in Heaven", "Wonderful Tonight", "Layla", "Cocaine" among the other great songs from a great album "Slowhand" (1979) -it can't be better then this.

As a fan of Eric Clapton i was captivated by for all 1 h 40 min of this show. There isn't any big show, because this is Royal Albert Hall and Eric Clapton - you know what you are getting into. Do i would LOVE to be there at this show - that was a thought that crossed my mind during the show which i just saw on a Blue Ray on a 2mx2m wide screen projector with all the sound systems ready roll. Terrific stuff.

Overall, if you are Eric Clapton's fan - you simply CAN NOT miss "Live at the Royal Albert Hall". Make sure its going to be a big screen and best audio system possible at your hand, because "Slowhand" is a blast.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Czempion
programme.desc: Marian (Marek Siudym), starzejący się mistrz kolarstwa, pracuje jako stróż na złomowisku samochodów. Przytłacza go samotne życie na odludziu. Ulega pokusie i podejmuje próbę zmiany swojej sytuacji. Okazuje się jednak, że nie jest to łatwe w nieznanym mu wirtualnym świecie, rzeczywistości selfie czy miłości na sprzedaż.

credits.actor: Marek Siudym
Michał Piela
Maria Patykiewicz
Krzysztof Rogucki, Sylwia Gola, Wojciech Chorąży

programme.title: Leszy
programme.desc: Krzysiek, po dziesięciu latach nieobecności, zabiera swojego syna na polowanie. Mężczyzna poprzez wyprawę myśliwską chce odzyskać zaufanie syna i nadrobić stracony czas. Adrenalina, alkohol i miło spędzony czas sprawiają, że mężczyźni się do siebie zbliżają. Jednak niedojrzałość Krzysztofa prowadzi doprowadza do wielkiej tragedii.

credits.actor: Tadeusz Ratuszniak
Łukasz Gawroński
Dominika Sakowicz

programme.title: Wiki
programme.desc: Autystyczna Wiki (Kamila Kobic) jest ciekawa świata. Musi zmierzyć się z trudną rzeczywistością. Pewnego dnia spotyka Mateusza (Adam Bobik), fana autobusów warszawskiej komunikacji miejskiej, który wprowadza radość do jej szarego życia.

credits.actor: Kamila Kobic
Magdalena Kizinkiewicz
Adam Bobik

programme.title: 60 kilo niczego
programme.desc: Zimny poranek w odkrywkowej kopalni kruszców. Krzysztof (Grzegorz Damięcki) zaczyna pierwszy dzień pracy na stanowisku kierownika. Wyraźnie nie pasuje on do środowiska pracowników fizycznych. W trosce o własną pozycję, zamierza trzymać dyscyplinę twardą ręką. Nagły wypadek, którego ofiarą staje się jeden z ukraińskich robotników, wystawia zasady moralne Krzysztofa na próbę. Zdaje on sobie sprawę z tego, że łatwo być stanowczym tylko w sprzyjających okolicznościach. Jednak trudno mu przeciwstawić się złu, kiedy w grę wchodzą dramatyczne konsekwencje.

credits.actor: Grzegorz Damięcki
Artem Manuilov
Andrzej Grabowski
Łukasz Nowicki, Grzegorz Kowalczyk, Olga Paszkowska
Grzegorz Damięcki, Andrzej Seweryn, Sylwia Juszczak
Grzegorz Damięcki, Andrzej Seweryn, Sylwia Juszczak

programme.title: Techno
programme.desc: 60-letni Ryszard (Leszek Abrahamowicz) jest rolnikiem, który żyje w izolacji od świata. Jego głównym zajęciem jest opieka nad chorą na alzheimera żoną, Joanną (Danuta Stenka). Stan kobiety coraz szybciej się pogarsza. Pewnego dnia mężczyzna poznaje młodą dziewczynę z wielkiego miasta, Sonię (Michalina Olszańska), która wprowadza go w świat muzyki techno. Dzięki temu, chociaż na krótką chwilę, Ryszard może zapomnieć o życiowych trudnościach.

credits.actor: Leszek Abrahamowicz
Danuta Stenka
Michalina Olszańska
Victoria Quesnel, Noémie Gantier, Tiphaine Raffier
Bukky Bakray, Kosar Ali, D'angelou Osei Kissiedu

Fifteen years later, a humanitarian effort would bring 3600 lost boys and girls to America."},"datePublished":"2014-11-07","description":"A group of Sudanese refugees, given the chance to resettle in the U.S., arrive in Kansas City, Missouri, where their encounter with an employment agency counselor forever changes all of their lives.","keywords":"kansas city missouri,refugee,refugee camp,kenya,resettlement","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2652092/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chungs69"},"dateCreated":"2014-09-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"This movie has it all and delivers","reviewBody":"This movie is based on true events and plays on the audiences emotions on every level. It tells a tale of brother-sisterhood, love, friendships, and dedication to family. Most importantly, it shows the extremes of humanity...how we as human beings can be so cruel but yet be so kind and caring. And as dramatic a movie as this was, there were several humorous points to ease the tensions of what this movie was really about. Also, just when you're thinking you're watching a movie starring Reese Witherspoon, the accompanying cast of Sudanese refugees steal the show. Great story, great directing, great cast, and great acting all around.\n\n'A Good Lie" was possibly the best movie at TIFF this year.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27332,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Spitsbergen
programme.desc: Magda (Magdalena Czerwińska), zawieszona ratowniczka medyczna, otrzymuje nagłe wezwanie. Oznacza to dla niej powrót do dramatycznych wydarzeń i ludzkich tragedii. Gdy opada poziom adrenaliny, kobieta przypomina sobie podróże na Spitsbergen - mroźną norweską wyspę na Morzu Arktycznym. To miejsce stało się dla niej powodem traumy, z którą do tej pory nie zdołała się uporać. Przerastają ją cudze nieszczęścia i własna przeszłość.

credits.actor: Magdalena Czerwińska
Marek Kossakowski
Marian Dziędziel

programme.title: Acid Rain
programme.desc: Młoda ucieka z domu jak najdalej od smutnej, bezbarwnej miejscowości. Szybko okazuje się, że podróż autostopem nie jest tak ekscytująca, jak się wydawało, kiedy znajduje się w środku nocy na obrzeżach postkomunistycznego miasta. Dziewczyna dostrzega na moście postać, która niebezpiecznie balansuje na barierce. Tak poznaje niezrównoważonego dziwaka Chudego. Oboje postanawiają na jakiś czas obrać taki sam kierunek podróży. Pod osłoną nocy snują się po mieście, w coraz dziwniejsze rejony, doświadczając niezwykłych emocji. Wkrótce między Młodą a Chudym tworzy się nienazwana więź. Całość oparta jest na płaszczyźnie psychodelicznej jak z narkotycznego transu.

programme.title: Myszy i szczury
programme.desc: Dramatyczne losy małego Adasia (Miłosz Kwiecień), którego przykre doświadczenia sprzed lat odbijają się na psychice całej rodziny. Wzruszająca historia o bezgranicznej miłości, przeznaczeniu, poczuciu winy i ponoszeniu konsekwencji za swoje czyny.

credits.actor: Michał Krzywicki
Kacper Anuszewski
Rafał Gerlach
Krzysztof Rogucki, Sylwia Gola, Wojciech Chorąży

programme.title: Leszy
programme.desc: Krzysiek, po dziesięciu latach nieobecności, zabiera swojego syna na polowanie. Mężczyzna poprzez wyprawę myśliwską chce odzyskać zaufanie syna i nadrobić stracony czas. Adrenalina, alkohol i miło spędzony czas sprawiają, że mężczyźni się do siebie zbliżają. Jednak niedojrzałość Krzysztofa prowadzi doprowadza do wielkiej tragedii.

credits.actor: Tadeusz Ratuszniak
Łukasz Gawroński
Dominika Sakowicz

programme.title: Wiki
programme.desc: Autystyczna Wiki (Kamila Kobic) jest ciekawa świata. Musi zmierzyć się z trudną rzeczywistością. Pewnego dnia spotyka Mateusza (Adam Bobik), fana autobusów warszawskiej komunikacji miejskiej, który wprowadza radość do jej szarego życia.

credits.actor: Kamila Kobic

programme.title: Przyjaciółki
programme.desc: 30-letnia Madde (Ella Lahdenmäki) robi zakupy ze swoimi najlepszymi przyjaciółkami, Aurą (Sonja Kuittinen) i Julią (Karoliina Niskanen), gdy nagle spotyka mroczną postać z przeszłości - swoją byłą koleżankę Elsi (Niina Koponen). Zszokowana próbuje się ukryć. Jednak towarzyszki jej na to nie pozwalają. Dziewczyna musi skonfrontować się z tym, co się kiedyś wydarzyło. Komedia o wzmacniającej się pozycji kobiet i przyjaźniach, które pozostają na zawsze.

basketball coach is sentenced to community service, forced to work with a team of mentally disabled players.","keywords":"singing in a car,singing on a bus,singing in an rv,singing on airplane,basketball","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6793580/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"realart_ds"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice movie, nice crew & a good message","reviewBody":"In the ironic world in which we live today, where the rights for all should be something common and accepted, where discrimination should be a word forgotten by the past, we realize that for nothing sexual,gender rights or worst in basic human rights as being able to be treated the same regardless of physical aspects or medical differences, the human is still being unable to treat the others as he would like to be treated himself . 

In this film we see this reality, but we also see how that assumption we always make in the face of what others can and can not do ends up being wrong. 

The improvement and achievements that for some do not seem to be the great thing, for many is an epic achievement. 

This film is not only well done in the film aspect, it also gave in the background aspect a lesson , that I hope many apply in their lives.

Not always the best movies have implicit the great effects, famous actors, and millionaire budgets, in this case the casting was perfect choice, the touch that the protagonists in real life are people with "mental disability", and I think they should be an example for many actors that today are more divas than what they act, the movie gave us also a script well taken, turns in to a comedy that takes you to the joy at times, (not simple laughs) and that true feeling sensation , and a very good direction that I think has merits that I hope the academy and the public in general can recognize.

For last ,remember we all are the same ............HUMANS, the movies should be this, something inclusive, as everything else should be

A movie that has to be seen by everyone, 100% enjoyable and to have a good time at the cinema

He meets Meg, an independent bush pilot, whose father is found dead in a mountain cave." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1363127/","name":"Northern Lights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNmNWRhMmQtNWU2Mi00NWFiLTkxNjctMWY4ZjllYzZiZDRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ0OTk1ODg@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005361/","name":"LeAnn Rimes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004827/","name":"Eddie Cibrian"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0493222/","name":"Greg Lawson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730500/","name":"Mike Robe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0077049/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0018094/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0181866/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115114/","name":"Janet Brownell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731465/","name":"Nora Roberts"}],"datePublished":"2009-03-21","description":"Nate Burns accepts a job as chief of police in Lunacy, Alaska, hoping to to get away from the traumatic death of his partner back in Baltimore. He meets Meg, an independent bush pilot, whose father is found dead in a mountain cave.","keywords":"dog,theft,bear,knife,fight","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1363127/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Renrac"},"dateCreated":"2009-08-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cant they make a decent movie??","reviewBody":""They keep taking Nora Roberts and pairing her wonderful novels to barely anything at all. Why does a mediocre guy like Nicholas Sparks get all of his novels on the big screen and Nora gets no special treatment beyond stunt casting?" 

I agree with this sentiment 100%. 

I read a lot, always have. I've never been a big romance or mystery lover but the first time i picked up a Nora Roberts novel I absolutely loved it and have read every book of hers I could find overseas since. I especially like her titles under her J.D. Rob pseudonym. The In Death line of books are fantastic! programme.title: Anakondy: Polowanie na krwawą orchideę
programme.desc: Grupa młodych naukowców pod przewodnictwem dr Jacka Byrona (Matthew Marsden) i jego współpracownika Gordona Mitchella (Morris Chestnut) wyrusza na ekspedycję w tropikalne rejony deszczowych lasów Borneo. Ich celem jest odnalezienie legendarnej "krwawej orchidei", tajemniczej rośliny o niezwykłym składzie chemicznym, który ma zapewniać długowieczność. Młodzi ludzie pełni zapału mają zamiar dzięki swemu odkryciu wzbogacić się. Okazuje się, że znalezienie rośliny nie jest takie łatwe. Kiedy ich łódź zostaje zatopiona, ekipa musi pokonywać bagniste tereny pieszo, co nie jest łatwe ani przyjemne. Zwłaszcza, że czyha na nich wiele przykrych niespodzianek. Wkrótce okazuje się, że drogocenna roślina ma swojego strażnika, śmiertelnie niebezpieczną bestię - olbrzymich rozmiarów węża. Dwight H. Little reżyserował też m.in. "Halloween 4: Powrót Michaela Myersa", "Upiora w operze" i serial "Z Archiwum X". Film nawiązuje do obrazu "Anakonda" z 1997 roku.

He meets Meg, an independent bush pilot, whose father is found dead in a mountain cave." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1363127/","name":"Northern Lights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNmNWRhMmQtNWU2Mi00NWFiLTkxNjctMWY4ZjllYzZiZDRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ0OTk1ODg@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005361/","name":"LeAnn Rimes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004827/","name":"Eddie Cibrian"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0493222/","name":"Greg Lawson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0730500/","name":"Mike Robe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0077049/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0018094/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0181866/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115114/","name":"Janet Brownell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731465/","name":"Nora Roberts"}],"datePublished":"2009-03-21","description":"Nate Burns accepts a job as chief of police in Lunacy, Alaska, hoping to to get away from the traumatic death of his partner back in Baltimore. Why does a mediocre guy like Nicholas Sparks get all of his novels on the big screen and Nora gets no special treatment beyond stunt casting?" 

I agree with this sentiment 100%. 

I read a lot, always have. I've never been a big romance or mystery lover but the first time i picked up a Nora Roberts novel I absolutely loved it and have read every book of hers I could find overseas since. I especially like her titles under her J.D. Rob pseudonym. The In Death line of books are fantastic! I just wish they could take such wonderful work.. and make a movie of at least near equal quality."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1703,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

(Punch)."},"datePublished":"2011-06-24","description":"A lazy, incompetent middle school teacher who hates her job, her students, and her co-workers is forced to return to teaching to make enough money for breast implants after her wealthy fiancé dumps her.","keywords":"bad teacher,fired from a job,bribery,cheating on a test,breast enlargement","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1284575/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StevePulaski"},"dateCreated":"2011-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"I think I'll be excused","reviewBody":"Bad Teacher is a hit and miss comedy, with a fair number of laughs, but a fair number of plot holes and questions. Before I even thought about this movie after seeing it, I went and watched Bad Santa for the first time. Both films have a similar premise with the lead character being unpleasant and offensive. But Bad Santa was written with a more style of dark comedy, and let's not forget, with a corrupt childhood and a "whatever" attitude, Billy Bob Thornton's character had a perfectly good reason to be "bad" and mean. Cameron Diaz has none other than she is just mean-spirited and has chosen to pursue a miserable lifestyle.

Elizabeth Halsey is our main character, portrayed by the lovely Cameron Diaz. Elizabeth is a teacher had a normal school, and comes home one day to her fiancée and finds out that his mother has convinced him to call of the wedding. Planning to possibly spend the rest of her life staying at home since her fiancée was rich, Elizabeth must return to the school where she shows her class movies every day while she naps at her desk.

Seeing the attractive substitute teacher Scott Delacorte (Timberlake), Elizabeth makes conversation to learn he has just gone through a breakup with a woman with large breasts. Elizabeth decides to under-go a breast enlargement surgery, a costly but rewarding surgery, to be more self-appreciative.

The main rival in the film is Amy Squirrel (Punch), another teacher in the building. She believes that Elizabeth is a fraud, scamming the school out of money (to pay for her surgery). There is also a strange attraction between Jason Segel's character as the gym teacher. The movie's biggest fault is it focuses more on Elizabeth's sometimes funny, sometimes not antics instead of building up the attraction it should with Jason Segel's character. When the film ends, we feel that the film itself didn't know how to end and just thought up something out of the blue just to give the film some sort of sun-shiny ending. The end would've been better, if we got more of a relationship between the two.

Another problem is that the students are never developed enough. The film has several students that speak to Miss Halsey individually, but it seems it can't make up its mind which one it wants to focus on. We have the brown nose girl and the sensitive kid who writes poetry and is crushing on the girl way out of his league. We get brief scenes with them, but we never see Elizabeth talk to one of the students very much. In Bad Santa, Thornton was always talking to kids and, despite his sour motivation, he was optimistic about the loner he picked up along the way.

The backstory isn't big either. If Cameron Diaz is such a miserable hack behind the desk, why did she take up teaching in the first place? How did she become a teacher? Does the principal never come in the classroom to find that Elizabeth is sleeping while the kids watch Scream? While I liked Diaz in There's Something About Mary and other things she has done, in this, she is just barely likable.

The jokes are funny. But boy does the writing fail it. When the jokes are funny, they are really funny. When the jokes fail, they fall flat on their face and are cringe inducing. The dry humping scene between Diaz and Timberlake is awkward, and is useless. It doesn't cause any advance in the plot or accomplishment among Diaz's part. It's simply there to have some sort of sex scene in a movie titled Bad Teacher.

Bad Teacher is cute, but ultimately not as dirty or as funny as it should be. The relationship between the characters is forced, no one on screen seems to be doing their best, and the screenplay, like I said, can be good but can really bad. A comedy that had potential, also had a really good movie it would be compared to for its lifetime. The result; Santa will live on while the Teacher will need an attitude adjustment.

Starring: Cameron Diaz, Jason Segel, and Justin Timberlake. Directed by: Jake Kasdan.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":195105,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: The Hateful Eight: Directed by Quentin Tarantino. With Samuel L. Jackson, Kurt Russell, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Walton Goggins. In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3460252/","name":"The Hateful Eight","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MTc1NTg5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTM2MDEzNzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000168/","name":"Samuel L. Jackson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000621/","name":"Kurt Russell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000492/","name":"Jennifer Jason Leigh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282627/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118437/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159642/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2079306521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4MjQ3MzgyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDcwMDM1NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4MjQ3MzgyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDcwMDM1NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In post-Civil War Wyoming, bounty hunters try to find shelter during a blizzard but get involved in a plot of betrayal and deception. Will they survive?"},"datePublished":"2015-12-30","description":"In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.","keywords":"bounty hunter,blizzard,murder,stagecoach,gang","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3460252/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"noahmed"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quinton Tarantino's Most Underrated Film","reviewBody":"I never saw this film back when it was released in 2015. But, I did manage to buy a copy of Blu-Ray. Now, when I first saw it, I thought this movie was flawless/perfect. I now know that no movie despite what anyone may say, is perfect. But I am firm believer that this is in fact Quinton Tarantino's most underrated and under-appreciated film. Everyone I've talked to, says the Hateful Eight isn't Tarantino's most re-watchable film. I disagree. With a phenomenal cast that really gets into their characters. Each one stands out and not one is forgetful. Samuel L. Jackson and Kurt Russell are the stars of this film and it shows. Their performances (in my opinion) were Oscar worthy. Don't even get me started on the story. This is basically a Who-Done-It play turned into a film. The complexity of this story should make the audience feel confused and turn their heads going, "what the hell is happening?". But it does the exact opposite. Everything flows perfectly. The pacing of this film, while it is almost 3 hours, it doesn't feel like it. The cinematography is great. The score brings tension and makes the audience uneasy. But I think my favorite thing of this film, is the scenery. Having these 8 characters who all hate each other, trapped by a blizzard. Really builds up the tension of the catastrophe that is coming. The only thing that is working against this film is the lengthy setup shots at the beginning of the movie. The first five minutes of the film is plagued by it and those tend to drag on. Beyond that, everything about this film is great.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":531210,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT2H48M"}</script><metacontent="

But, I did manage to buy a copy of Blu-Ray. Now, when I first saw it, I thought this movie was flawless/perfect. I now know that no movie despite what anyone may say, is perfect. But I am firm believer that this is in fact Quinton Tarantino's most underrated and under-appreciated film. Everyone I've talked to, says the Hateful Eight isn't Tarantino's most re-watchable film. I disagree. With a phenomenal cast that really gets into their characters. Each one stands out and not one is forgetful. Samuel L. Jackson and Kurt Russell are the stars of this film and it shows. Their performances (in my opinion) were Oscar worthy. Don't even get me started on the story. This is basically a Who-Done-It play turned into a film. The complexity of this story should make the audience feel confused and turn their heads going, "what the hell is happening?". But it does the exact opposite. Everything flows perfectly. The pacing of this film, while it is almost 3 hours, it doesn't feel like it. The cinematography is great. The score brings tension and makes the audience uneasy. But I think my favorite thing of this film, is the scenery. Having these 8 characters who all hate each other, trapped by a blizzard. Really builds up the tension of the catastrophe that is coming. The only thing that is working against this film is the lengthy setup shots at the beginning of the movie. The first five minutes of the film is plagued by it and those tend to drag on. But I am firm believer that this is in fact Quinton Tarantino's most underrated and under-appreciated film. Everyone I've talked to, says the Hateful Eight isn't Tarantino's most re-watchable film. I disagree. With a phenomenal cast that really gets into their characters. Each one stands out and not one is forgetful. Samuel L. Jackson and Kurt Russell are the stars of this film and it shows. In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3460252/","name":"The Hateful Eight","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MTc1NTg5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTM2MDEzNzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000168/","name":"Samuel L. Jackson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000621/","name":"Kurt Russell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000492/","name":"Jennifer Jason Leigh"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282627/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118437/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159642/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2079306521","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4MjQ3MzgyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDcwMDM1NjE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4MjQ3MzgyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDcwMDM1NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In post-Civil War Wyoming, bounty hunters try to find shelter during a blizzard but get involved in a plot of betrayal and deception. Will they survive?","datePublished":"2015-12-30","description":"In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.","keywords":"bounty hunter,blizzard,murder,stagecoach,gang","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3460252/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"noahmed","dateCreated":"2020-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quinton Tarantino's Most Underrated Film","reviewBody":"I never saw this film back when it was released in 2015. But, I did manage to buy a copy of Blu-Ray. Now, when I first saw it, I thought this movie was flawless/perfect. I now know that no movie despite what anyone may say, is perfect. But I am firm believer that this is in fact Quinton Tarantino's most underrated and under-appreciated film. Everyone I've talked to, says the Hateful Eight isn't Tarantino's most re-watchable film. I disagree. With a phenomenal cast that really gets into their characters. Each one stands out and not one is forgetful. Samuel L. Jackson and Kurt Russell are the stars of this film and it shows. Their performances (in my opinion) were Oscar worthy. Don't even get me started on the story. This is basically a Who-Done-It play turned into a film. The complexity of this story should make the audience feel confused and turn their heads going, "what the hell is happening?". But it does the exact opposite. Everything flows perfectly. The pacing of this film, while it is almost 3 hours, it doesn't feel like it. The cinematography is great. The score brings tension and makes the audience uneasy. But I think my favorite thing of this film, is the scenery. Having these 8 characters who all hate each other, trapped by a blizzard. Really builds up the tension of the catastrophe that is coming. The only thing that is working against this film is the lengthy setup shots at the beginning of the movie. The first five minutes of the film is plagued by it and those tend to drag on. Beyond that, everything about this film is great.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":531210,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"duration":"PT2H48M"</script><metacontent="

Will they survive?"},"datePublished":"2015-12-30","description":"In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.","keywords":"bounty hunter,blizzard,murder,stagecoach,gang","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3460252/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"noahmed"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quinton Tarantino's Most Underrated Film","reviewBody":"I never saw this film back when it was released in 2015. But, I did manage to buy a copy of Blu-Ray. Now, when I first saw it, I thought this movie was flawless/perfect. I now know that no movie despite what anyone may say, is perfect. But I am firm believer that this is in fact Quinton Tarantino's most underrated and under-appreciated film. Everyone I've talked to, says the Hateful Eight isn't Tarantino's most re-watchable film. I disagree. With a phenomenal cast that really gets into their characters. Each one stands out and not one is forgetful. Samuel L. Jackson and Kurt Russell are the stars of this film and it shows. Their performances (in my opinion) were Oscar worthy. Don't even get me started on the story. This is basically a Who-Done-It play turned into a film. The complexity of this story should make the audience feel confused and turn their heads going, "what the hell is happening?". But it does the exact opposite. Everything flows perfectly. The pacing of this film, while it is almost 3 hours, it doesn't feel like it. The cinematography is great. The score brings tension and makes the audience uneasy. But I think my favorite thing of this film, is the scenery. Having these 8 characters who all hate each other, trapped by a blizzard. Really builds up the tension of the catastrophe that is coming. The only thing that is working against this film is the lengthy setup shots at the beginning of the movie. The first five minutes of the film is plagued by it and those tend to drag on. Beyond that, everything about this film is great.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":531210,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT2H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Klopsiki i inne zjawiska pogodowe
programme.desc: Directed by Phil Lord, Christopher Miller. With Anna Faris, Bill Hader, Bruce Campbell, James Caan. A local scientist is often regarded as a failure until he invents a machine that can make food fall from the sky. But little does he know, that things are about to take a turn for the worst.
programme.category: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy, Sci-Fi
programme.review: --- Actors: Bill Hader (role=Flint Lockwood), Anna Faris (role=Sam Sparks), James Caan (role=Tim Lockwood), Bruce Campbell (role=Mayor Shelbourne), Mr. T (role=Earl Devereaux), Bobb'e J. Thompson (role=Cal Devereaux), Benjamin Bratt (role=Manny), Neil Patrick Harris (role=Steve), Al Roker (role=Patrick Patrickson), Lauren Graham (role=Fran Lockwood), Will Forte (role=Joe Towne)

programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2
Klopsiki kontratakują
programme.desc:
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2: Directed by Cody Cameron, Kris Pearn. With Bill Hader, Anna Faris, James Caan, Will Forte. Flint Lockwood now works at The Live Corp Company for his idol Chester V. But he's forced to leave his post when he learns that his most infamous machine is still operational, and is churning out menacing food-animal hybrids." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1985966/","name":"Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzNDM0MDI1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQ5NzYxOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0352778/","name":"Bill Hader"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267506/","name":"Anna Faris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0287182/","name":"Will Forte"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0970606/","name":"Cody Cameron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2329165/","name":"Kris Pearn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121181/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1106214/","name":"Erica Rivinoja"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0197855/","name":"John Francis Daley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326246/","name":"Jonathan Goldstein"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi479570201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4NTU1ODkyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzkwNTk3OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4NTU1ODkyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzkwNTk3OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Flint Lockwood now works at The Live Corp Company for his idol Chester V. But he's forced to leave his post when he learns that his most infamous machine is still operational and is churning out menacing food-animal hybrids."},"datePublished":"2013-09-27","description":"Flint Lockwood now works at The Live Corp Company for his idol Chester V. But he's forced to leave his post when he learns that his most infamous machine is still operational, and is churning out menacing food-animal hybrids.","keywords":"island,anthropomorphic food,villain,double cross,numbered sequel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1985966/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chris_rowe-881-168820"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why are people so negative!!","reviewBody":"Ill start by saying I am 26 and I went with my 25 year old partner to watch this film, I have to review this film solely for the reason that people have been overly harsh with there assessments of this movie.

No animation film bar classic Disney really goes into any great story lines or tries to really pull at your heart strings or tries to go all in to win an Oscar, so for the people giving this a low rating I am genuinely baffled as to why.

These films in recent times try and do the following in my eyes: 1)Show a great imagination to capture an audience. 2)Create characters within the film that will sell merchandise as well as be loved by the people watching. 3)Entertain and show plot twists to keep the viewers engrossed throughout. 4)Be accessible for as many age groups as they can.

This film does all of that and more and is completely enjoyable. It is smart, funny and totally awesome for kids and adults alike.

Films like this aren't ever going to be up there with all time greats! but its films like this that warm your heart and make you smile!.

It is a great film for family, kids or even a date night.

Great film and look forward to number 3.

Enjoy and guarantee you will leave satisfied!!!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":93004,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

But he's forced to leave his post when he learns that his most infamous machine is still operational, and is churning out menacing food-animal hybrids." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1985966/","name":"Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzNDM0MDI1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQ5NzYxOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0352778/","name":"Bill Hader","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267506/","name":"Anna Faris","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0287182/","name":"Will Forte"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0970606/","name":"Cody Cameron","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2329165/","name":"Kris Pearn"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121181/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1106214/","name":"Erica Rivinoja","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0197855/","name":"John Francis Daley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326246/","name":"Jonathan Goldstein"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi479570201","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4NTU1ODkyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzkwNTk3OQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4NTU1ODkyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzkwNTk3OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Flint Lockwood now works at The Live Corp Company for his idol Chester V. But he's forced to leave his post when he learns that his most infamous machine is still operational and is churning out menacing food-animal hybrids.","datePublished":"2013-09-27","description":"Flint Lockwood now works at The Live Corp Company for his idol Chester V. But he's forced to leave his post when he learns that his most infamous machine is still operational, and is churning out menacing food-animal hybrids.","keywords":"island,anthropomorphic food,villain,double cross,numbered sequel","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1985966/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"chris_rowe-881-168820","dateCreated":"2013-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why are people so negative!!","reviewBody":"Ill start by saying I am 26 and I went with my 25 year old partner to watch this film, I have to review this film solely for the reason that people have been overly harsh with there assessments of this movie.

No animation film bar classic Disney really goes into any great story lines or tries to really pull at your heart strings or tries to go all in to win an Oscar, so for the people giving this a low rating I am genuinely baffled as to why.

These films in recent times try and do the following in my eyes: 1)Show a great imagination to capture an audience. 2)Create characters within the film that will sell merchandise as well as be loved by the people watching. 3)Entertain and show plot twists to keep the viewers engrossed throughout. 4)Be accessible for as many age groups as they can.

This film does all of that and more and is completely enjoyable. It is smart, funny and totally awesome for kids and adults alike.

Films like this aren't ever going to be up there with all time greats! but its films like this that warm your heart and make you smile!.

It is a great film for family, kids or even a date night.

Great film and look forward to number 3.

Enjoy and guarantee you will leave satisfied!!!!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":93004,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"duration":"PT1H35M"</script><metacontent="
